title: Spanberger Critiques Trump's Affordability Claims in Democratic Response
summary: Governor Abigail Spanberger of Virginia delivered the Democratic response to President Trump's State of the Union address, arguing that his policies have not made life more affordable for Americans. She highlighted issues such as health care and housing costs, stating that Trump's claims about reducing expenses are untrue. Instead, Spanberger emphasized that Democrats are intensely focused on addressing affordability in communities nationwide. She pointed out that problems like affording prescriptions or starting businesses keep people awake at night and deserve attention from leaders. Spanberger, elected as Virginia's first woman governor in an off-cycle election last November, is a vocal critic of Trump, and her remarks were seen as part of Democratic efforts to challenge Republican policies ahead of midterm elections. The article contrasts Trump's speech, where he touted affordability achievements, with Spanberger's rebuttal, framing it as a political debate over economic issues.
